Hi 

On Wed 26-Feb-2003 at 05:06:44PM +0000, Nic Ferrier wrote:
> 
> No... 401 is authentication challenge. Whenever the UA recieves an
> authentication challenge it should respond with whatever auth
> details it has got.

My confusion is how people set things up on the server side so that
after a client has, by mistake, typed the wrong passwd, and
submitted it they can be re-prompted for a username and passwd
again.

In my experience the only way to get a new prompt for a username and
passwd is to shut the browser and start again.

> That may be the subject of your confusion. Some caching somewhere?

Perhaps, I generally run everything through squid.

> I'm a hippy so I never use IE and may not have experienced some
> cache induced problem with authentication.

I only know mozilla on Linux well and I usually have it set to use a
1k cache and to refresh everything every time...

Chris
